rules.natural: Provided that the results are manipulated, then if the data are fraudulent, the paper is not retracted.
Whenever the experiment is replicated, the results are verified.
Either the experiment is replicated, or the research is funded by the grant.
Under the condition that the results are verified, the findings are significant.
If the methodology is flawed, then the findings are not significant.
Either the methodology is flawed, or the samples are contaminated.
Provided that the samples are contaminated, the data are unreliable.
If the data are unreliable, then the findings are not significant.
Whenever the paper is influential, it is cited in the study.
Either the researcher presented at the conference, or if the research is not funded by the grant, then the researcher did not publish in the journal.
Provided that the research is groundbreaking, the paper is influential.
Under the condition that the approach is novel, the paper is influential.
If the work is recognized, then either the research is groundbreaking or the approach is novel.
Whenever the paper is rejected by the journal, the researcher does not present at the conference.
Either the paper is rejected by the journal, or it is accepted by the conference.
If the paper is cited in the study, then under the condition that if the paper is not accepted by the conference, then the researcher does not present at the conference, the paper is revised.
If the researcher authored the paper, then it was reviewed by a peer.
Provided that the paper is reviewed by a peer, it is cited in the study.
If the research is funded by the grant, then it is funded by the grant.
Provided that if the paper is not accepted by the conference, then the researcher does not present at the conference, the paper is not revised.
Whenever the research is not funded by the grant, the paper is retracted.
If the research is not funded by the grant, then the researcher publishes in the journal.

target.natural: The research is funded by the grant.

natural_facts.G: The research was funded by the grant.

(A11 → ¬A10).natural: If the data are fraudulent, then the paper is not retracted.

(A12 → (A11 → ¬A10)).natural: Provided that the results are manipulated, then if the data are fraudulent, the paper is not retracted.

(A13 → A14).natural: Whenever the experiment is replicated, the results are verified.

(A13 ∨ G).natural: Either the experiment is replicated, or the research is funded by the grant.

(A14 → A15).natural: Under the condition that the results are verified, the findings are significant.

(A16 → ¬A15).natural: If the methodology is flawed, then the findings are not significant.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Either the methodology is flawed, or the samples are contaminated.

(A17 → A18).natural: Provided that the samples are contaminated, the data are unreliable.

(A17 → ¬A15).natural: Under the condition that the samples are contaminated, the findings are not significant.

(A18 → ¬A15).natural: If the data are unreliable, then the findings are not significant.

(A19 → A6).natural: Whenever the paper is influential, it is cited in the study.

(A2 ∨ (¬G → ¬A1)).natural: Either the researcher presented at the conference, or if the research is not funded by the grant, then the researcher did not publish in the journal.

(A20 → A19).natural: Provided that the research is groundbreaking, the paper is influential.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: Either the research is groundbreaking, or the approach is novel.

(A21 → A19).natural: Under the condition that the approach is novel, the paper is influential.

(A22 → (A20 ∨ A21)).natural: If the work is recognized, then either the research is groundbreaking or the approach is novel.

(A3 → ¬A2).natural: Whenever the paper is rejected by the journal, the researcher does not present at the conference.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Either the paper is rejected by the journal, or it is accepted by the conference.

(A4 → ¬A2).natural: Provided that the paper is accepted by the conference, the researcher does not present at the conference.

(A6 → (¬(A4 → ¬A2) → A5)).natural: If the paper is cited in the study, then under the condition that if the paper is not accepted by the conference, then the researcher does not present at the conference, the paper is revised.

(A7 → A6).natural: Whenever the researcher authored the paper, it is cited in the study.

(A7 → A8).natural: If the researcher authored the paper, then it was reviewed by a peer.

(A8 → A6).natural: Provided that the paper is reviewed by a peer, it is cited in the study.

(A9 → G).natural: If the research is funded by the grant, then it is funded by the grant.

(¬(A4 → ¬A2) → A5).natural: Under the condition that if the paper is not accepted by the conference, then the researcher does not present at the conference, the paper is revised.

(¬(A4 → ¬A2) → ¬A5).natural: Provided that if the paper is not accepted by the conference, then the researcher does not present at the conference, the paper is not revised.

(¬A9 → A10).natural: Whenever the research is not funded by the grant, the paper is retracted.

(¬G → A1).natural: If the research is not funded by the grant, then the researcher publishes in the journal.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: Under the condition that the research is not funded by the grant, the researcher does not publish in the journal.

A6.natural: The paper is cited in the study.

A9.natural: The research is funded by the grant.

G.natural: The research is funded by the grant.

¬A10.natural: It is not the case that the paper is retracted.

¬A14.natural: It is not the case that the results are verified.

¬A2.natural: The researcher does not present at the conference.
